questions.question: She congratulated …………………………..
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: You are worse than …………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are considered more appropriate after as and than.

questions.question: He stabbed ………………………….. with a knife.
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: ‘Whose car is this?’ ‘It is …………………………..’
questions.description: It is hers means the same as it is her car.

questions.question: I did it …………………………… as there was no one to help me.
Please eat more vegetables and do …………………………. a favor.
It is your fault, not ………………………….
questions.description: Not mine means the same as not my fault.

questions.question: I showed her my ID proof, but she couldn’t show me ………………………………
That cat of ………………………….. has drank my milk.
I ……………………….. spoke to the Minister.
questions.description: For emphasis, use the emphatic pronoun.

questions.question: This cat is …………………………..
questions.description: That cat is theirs means the same as that is their cat.
